pokemon.name: Victini
pokemon.description: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.

pokemon.name: Snivy
pokemon.description: It is very intelligent and calm. Being exposed to lots of sunlight makes its movements swifter.

pokemon.name: Servine
pokemon.description: It moves along the ground as if sliding. Its swift movements befuddle its foes, and it then attacks with a vine whip.

pokemon.name: Serperior
pokemon.description: It can stop its opponents' movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.

pokemon.name: Tepig
pokemon.description: It can deftly dodge its foe's attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.

pokemon.name: Pignite
pokemon.description: The more it eats, the more fuel it has to make the fire in its stomach. This fills it with even more power.

pokemon.name: Emboar
pokemon.description: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.

pokemon.name: Oshawott
pokemon.description: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.

pokemon.name: Dewott
pokemon.description: Scalchop techniques differ from one Dewott to another. It never neglects maintaining its scalchops.

pokemon.name: Samurott
pokemon.description: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. A simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.

pokemon.name: Patrat
pokemon.description: Using food stored in cheek pouches, they can keep watch for days. They use their tails to communicate with others.

pokemon.name: Watchog
pokemon.description: Its home is in grassy areas. It protects its nose with its tail while it assists with food gathering.

pokemon.name: Lillipup
pokemon.description: This Pokémon is very popular as a herding dog in the Unova region. As it runs, it generates electricity from the base of its tail.

pokemon.name: Herdier
pokemon.description: The longer its black fur grows, the harder and more impervious it gets. Claws and fangs can't easily penetrate it.

pokemon.name: Stoutland
pokemon.description: Its fur is long and thick. A long time ago in cold regions, every household kept a Stoutland.

pokemon.name: Purrloin
pokemon.description: They steal from people for fun, but their victims can't help but forgive them. Their deceptively cute act is perfect.

pokemon.name: Liepard
pokemon.description: Stealthily, it sneaks up on its target, striking from behind before its victim has a chance to react.

pokemon.name: Pansage
pokemon.description: It shares the leaf on its head with weary-looking Pokémon. These leaves are known to relieve stress.

pokemon.name: Simisage
pokemon.description: It attacks enemies with strikes of its thorn-covered tail. This Pokémon is wild tempered.

pokemon.name: Pansear
pokemon.description: It loves to help out with tough tasks. It loves sweet things, so it's always looking for snacks.

pokemon.name: Simisear
pokemon.description: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail, and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.

pokemon.name: Panpour
pokemon.description: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.

pokemon.name: Simipour
pokemon.description: The high-pressure water expelled from its tail is so powerful, it can destroy a concrete wall.

pokemon.name: Munna
pokemon.description: It eats the dreams of people and Pokémon. When it eats a pleasant dream, it expels pink-colored mist.

pokemon.name: Musharna
pokemon.description: The mist emanating from their foreheads is packed with the dreams of people and Pokémon.

pokemon.name: Pidove
pokemon.description: It's forgetful and not very bright, but many Trainers love it anyway for its friendliness and sincerity.

pokemon.name: Tranquill
pokemon.description: No matter where in the world it goes, it knows where its nest is, so it never gets separated from its Trainer.

pokemon.name: Unfezant
pokemon.description: The male with the largest plumage has the most beautiful feathers. It's an ideal choice for a wife.

pokemon.name: Blitzle
pokemon.description: When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear. It can catch lightning with its mane and store the electricity.

pokemon.name: Zebstrika
pokemon.description: This ill-tempered Pokémon is dangerous because when it's angry, it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.

pokemon.name: Roggenrola
pokemon.description: Its ear is hexagonal in shape. Compressed underground, its body is as hard as steel.

pokemon.name: Boldore
pokemon.description: When it overflows with power, the orange crystal on its body glows. It looks for underground water in caves.

pokemon.name: Gigalith
pokemon.description: Compressing the energy from its internal core lets it fire off an attack capable of blowing away a mountain.

pokemon.name: Woobat
pokemon.description: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.

pokemon.name: Swoobat
pokemon.description: Anyone who comes into contact with the ultrasonic waves emitted by a courting male experiences a positive mood shift.

pokemon.name: Drilbur
pokemon.description: It can dig through the ground at a speed of 30 mph. It could give a car running aboveground a good race.

pokemon.name: Excadrill
pokemon.description: More than 300 feet below the surface, it builds labyrinthine nests. It's also known to trigger earthquakes.

pokemon.name: Audino
pokemon.description: Using the feelers on its ears, it can tell how someone is feeling or when an egg might hatch.

pokemon.name: Timburr
pokemon.description: It carries a well-made log, which it uses to smash its opponents. In the homes of humans, it is used to help with construction.

pokemon.name: Gurdurr
pokemon.description: On construction sites, this Pokémon carries s huge girder. It is one of the Pokémon that pulls Poke Marts.

pokemon.name: Conkeldurr
pokemon.description: It can show up anywhere there is construction. It skillfully wields a massive concrete pillar.

pokemon.name: Tympole
pokemon.description: They warn others of danger by vibrating their cheeks to create a high-pitched sound.

pokemon.name: Palpitoad
pokemon.description: It weakens its prey with sound waves intense enough to cause headaches, then entangles them with its sticky tongue.

pokemon.name: Seismitoad
pokemon.description: It increases the power of its punches by vibrating the bumps on its fists. It can turn a boulder to rubble with one punch.

pokemon.name: Throh
pokemon.description: When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild Throh use vines to weave their own belts.

pokemon.name: Sawk
pokemon.description: Tying their belts gets them pumped and makes their punches more destructive. Disturbing their training angers them.

pokemon.name: Sewaddle
pokemon.description: Larvae of this species are known to wrap leaves around their bodies for protection.

pokemon.name: Swadloon
pokemon.description: A long, long time ago, it lived in the depths of the sea. Then humans transformed it into energy.

pokemon.name: Leavanny
pokemon.description: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves, using the cutters on its arms and sticky silk.

pokemon.name: Venipede
pokemon.description: It discovers what is going on around it by using the feelers on its head and tail. It is brutally aggressive.

pokemon.name: Whirlipede
pokemon.description: Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.

pokemon.name: Scolipede
pokemon.description: With quick movements, it chases down its foes, attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails.

pokemon.name: Cottonee
pokemon.description: When attacked, it expels cotton from its body to create a diversion. The cotton is full of paralyzing spores.

pokemon.name: Whimsicott
pokemon.description: Wind from its cotton can stun opponents. Its pollen also grows sticky for a time, so it collects lots of pollen.

pokemon.name: Petilil
pokemon.description: It lives in areas with clean air and water. Its long hair shines like the sun's rays.

pokemon.name: Lilligant
pokemon.description: When it gets the chance, it burrows its slimy, sucker-tipped mouth into the prey and drains the prey's bodily fluids.

pokemon.name: Basculin
pokemon.description: Red and blue Basculin get along so poorly, they'll start fighting instantly. These Pokémon are very hostile.

pokemon.name: Sandile
pokemon.description: When they see an enemy, their hairs stand on end and their tails aim straight up as they prepare to confront their opponent.

pokemon.name: Krokorok
pokemon.description: It is a common sight in deserts. Its sand pouch has grown large, thanks to the constant collecting of sand.

pokemon.name: Krookodile
pokemon.description: They never allow prey to escape. Their jaws are so powerful, they can crush the body of an automobile.

pokemon.name: Darumaka
pokemon.description: When it sleeps, it pulls its limbs into its body and its internal fire goes down to 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit.

pokemon.name: Darmanitan
pokemon.description: Its internal fire burns at 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit, making enough power that it can destroy a dump truck with one punch.

pokemon.name: Maractus
pokemon.description: When it moves rhythmically, it makes a sound similar to maracas, which has been known to make opponents nervous.

pokemon.name: Dwebble
pokemon.description: When it finds a stone of a suitable size, it secretes a liquid from its mouth to open up a hole to crawl into.

pokemon.name: Crustle
pokemon.description: It possesses legs of enormous strength, enabling it to carry heavy slabs for many days, even when crossing arid land.

pokemon.name: Scraggy
pokemon.description: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck.

pokemon.name: Scrafty
pokemon.description: Groups of them beat up anything that enters their territory. Each can spit acidic liquid from its mouth.

pokemon.name: Sigilyph
pokemon.description: The guardians of an ancient city, they use their psychic power to attack enemies that invade their territory.

pokemon.name: Yamask
pokemon.description: These Pokémon arose from the spirits of people interred in graves in past ages. Each retains memories of its former life.

pokemon.name: Cofagrigus
pokemon.description: It has been said that they swallow those who get too close and turn them into mummies. They like to eat gold nuggets.

pokemon.name: Tirtouga
pokemon.description: About 100 million years ago, these Pokémon swam in oceans. It is thought they also went on land to attack prey.

pokemon.name: Carracosta
pokemon.description: It could knock out a foe with a slap from one of its developed front appendages and chew it up, shell or bones and all.

pokemon.name: Archen
pokemon.description: The bones of its wings are thought to be the remains of its ancestors who couldn’t fly. It runs as quickly as any other bird Pokémon.

pokemon.name: Archeops
pokemon.description: They are intelligent and will cooperate to catch prey. From the ground, they use a running start to take flight.

pokemon.name: Trubbish
pokemon.description: Trubbish’s favorite places are unsanitary ones. If you leave trash lying around, you could even find one of these Pokémon living in your room.

pokemon.name: Garbodor
pokemon.description: They absorb garbage and make it part of their bodies. They shoot a poisonous liquid from their right-hand fingertips.

pokemon.name: Zorua
pokemon.description: It changes into the forms of others to surprise them. Apparently, it often transforms into a silent child.

pokemon.name: Zoroark
pokemon.description: It protects the safety of its pack by tricking its opponents. Predators go after the weakest link in a herd, so this Pokémon is naturally cunning.

pokemon.name: Minccino
pokemon.description: They greet one another by rubbing each other with their tails, which are always kept well groomed and clean.

pokemon.name: Cinccino
pokemon.description: Their white fur feels amazing to touch. Their fur repels dust and prevents static electricity from building up.

pokemon.name: Gothita
pokemon.description: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon. Apparently, they are looking at something that only they can see.

pokemon.name: Gothorita
pokemon.description: They use hypnosis to control people and Pokémon. Tales of Gothorita leading people astray are told in every corner.

pokemon.name: Gothitelle
pokemon.description: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power.

pokemon.name: Solosis
pokemon.description: They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.

pokemon.name: Duosion
pokemon.description: When their brains, now divided in two, are thinking the same thought, these Pokémon exhibit their maximum psychic power.

pokemon.name: Reuniclus
pokemon.description: The green fluid secreted by its body contains special enzymes that cause Pokémon it slams into to combust spontaneously.

pokemon.name: Ducklett
pokemon.description: These bird Pokémon are excellent divers. They swim around in lovely flocks, causing the scattered feathers to resemble a bunch of flowers.

pokemon.name: Swanna
pokemon.description: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.

pokemon.name: Vanillite
pokemon.description: When the temperature rose at the end of the Ice Age, most Vanillite migrated to colder areas. They didn't return until a thick layer of ice had covered the region.

pokemon.name: Vanillish
pokemon.description: Snowy mountains are this Pokémon's habitat. During an ancient ice age, they moved to southern areas.

pokemon.name: Vanilluxe
pokemon.description: This Pokémon has existed since the Ice Age. It controls particles of ice, freezes its opponents, and creates ice crystals to protect itself.

pokemon.name: Deerling
pokemon.description: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon's fur. People use it to mark the seasons.

pokemon.name: Sawsbuck
pokemon.description: They migrate according to the seasons, so some people call Sawsbuck the harbingers of spring.

pokemon.name: Emolga
pokemon.description: They store up electricity in their cheeks, so you'll feel a tingly shock if you touch them.

pokemon.name: Karrablast
pokemon.description: It evolves when bathed in an electric-like energy along with Shelmet. Karrablast will seek out opponents to pick fights with.

pokemon.name: Escavalier
pokemon.description: They fly around at high speed, striking with their pointed spears. Even when in trouble, they face opponents bravely.

pokemon.name: Foongus
pokemon.description: It lures Pokémon with its pattern that looks just like a Poké Ball, then releases poison spores.

pokemon.name: Amoonguss
pokemon.description: It moves the caps on both arms and does a dance to lure prey. It prefers damp places.

pokemon.name: Frillish
pokemon.description: Lurking in the shallows, it patiently waits for prey to come close. When it does, Frillish and its tentacles seize and poison it.

pokemon.name: Jellicent
pokemon.description: In times long past, governors of castles would invite Jellicent to create barriers against invaders.

pokemon.name: Alomomola
pokemon.description: The special membrane enveloping Alomomola's body allows it to heal wounds by releasing a healing membrane.

pokemon.name: Joltik
pokemon.description: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

pokemon.name: Galvantula
pokemon.description: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out a sticky thread and then discharging high-voltage current.

pokemon.name: Ferroseed
pokemon.description: They stick their spikes into cave walls and absorb the minerals they find in the rock.

pokemon.name: Ferrothorn
pokemon.description: They attach themselves to cave ceilings, firing steel spikes at targets passing beneath them.

pokemon.name: Klink
pokemon.description: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.

pokemon.name: Klang
pokemon.description: By changing the direction in which it rotates, it communicates its feelings to others. When angry, it rotates faster.

pokemon.name: Klinklang
pokemon.description: The gear with the red core is rotated at high speed for a rapid energy charge.

pokemon.name: Tynamo
pokemon.description: While one alone doesn't have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.

pokemon.name: Eelektrik
pokemon.description: It wraps itself around its prey and paralyzes it with electricity from the round spots on its sides. Then it chomps.

pokemon.name: Eelektross
pokemon.description: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.

pokemon.name: Elgyem
pokemon.description: It uses its strong psychic power to squeeze its opponent's brain, causing unendurable headaches.

pokemon.name: Beheeyem
pokemon.description: It can manipulate an opponent's memory. Apparently, it communicates by flashing its three different-colored fingers.

pokemon.name: Litwick
pokemon.description: Litwick shines a light that absorbs the life energy of people and Pokémon, which becomes the fuel that it burns.

pokemon.name: Lampent
pokemon.description: This ominous Pokémon is feared. Through cities it wanders, searching for the spirits of the fallen.

pokemon.name: Chandelure
pokemon.description: Being consumed in Chandelure's flame burns up the spirit, leaving the body behind.

pokemon.name: Axew
pokemon.description: They use their tusks to crush the berries they eat. Repeated regrowth makes their tusks strong and sharp.

pokemon.name: Fraxure
pokemon.description: Since a broken tusk will not grow back, they diligently sharpen their tusks on river rocks after they've been fighting.

pokemon.name: Haxorus
pokemon.description: Their sturdy tusks will stay sharp even if used to cut steel beams. These Pokémon are covered in hard armor.

pokemon.name: Cubchoo
pokemon.description: Its nose is always running. It sniffs the snot back up because the mucus provides the raw material for its moves.

pokemon.name: Beartic
pokemon.description: It can make its breath freeze at will. When threatened, it spews a cloud of chilled air.

pokemon.name: Cryogonal
pokemon.description: They are born in snow clouds. They use chains made of ice crystals to capture prey.

pokemon.name: Shelmet
pokemon.description: When attacked, it defends itself by closing the lid of its shell. It can spit a sticky, poisonous liquid.

pokemon.name: Accelgor
pokemon.description: Having removed its heavy shell, it moves lightly and at speed. It races through narrow caves as if flying.

pokemon.name: Stunfisk
pokemon.description: It lies perfectly still in the mud. It waits for prey to touch it. When that happens, it leaps at the prey and delivers a jolt of electricity.

pokemon.name: Mienfoo
pokemon.description: When Mienshao has fully honed its psychic powers, its fur becomes even silkier than before.

pokemon.name: Mienshao
pokemon.description: It takes pride in the speed at which it can use moves. What it loses in power, it makes up for in quantity.

pokemon.name: Druddigon
pokemon.description: It warms its body by absorbing sunlight with its wings. When its body temperature falls, it can no longer move.

pokemon.name: Golett
pokemon.description: The energy that burns inside it enables it to move, but no one has yet been able to identify this energy.

pokemon.name: Golurk
pokemon.description: It flies across the sky at Mach speeds. Removing the seal on its chest makes its internal energy go out of control.

pokemon.name: Pawniard
pokemon.description: Blades comprise this Pokémon's entire body. If battling dulls the blades, it sharpens them on stones by the river.

pokemon.name: Bisharp
pokemon.description: It leads a group of Pawniard. It battles to become the boss, but will be driven from the group if it loses.

pokemon.name: Bouffalant
pokemon.description: They charge wildly and headbutt everything. Their headbutts have enough destructive force to derail a train.

pokemon.name: Rufflet
pokemon.description: They crush berries with their talons. They bravely stand up to any opponent, no matter how strong it is.

pokemon.name: Braviary
pokemon.description: This Pokémon has a great love of battle and will not flinch at anything. It will brave any danger to protect its brethren.

pokemon.name: Vullaby
pokemon.description: Its wings are too tiny to allow it to fly. As the time approaches for it to evolve, it discards the bones it was wearing.

pokemon.name: Mandibuzz
pokemon.description: It makes a nest out of bones it finds. It grabs weakened prey in its talons and hauls it to its nest of bones.

pokemon.name: Heatmor
pokemon.description: Using their very hot, flame-covered tongues, they burn through Durant's steel bodies and consume their insides.

pokemon.name: Durant
pokemon.description: Durant dig nests in mountains. They build their complicated, interconnected tunnels into mazes.

pokemon.name: Deino
pokemon.description: They cannot see, so they tackle and bite to learn about their surroundings. Their bodies are covered in wounds.

pokemon.name: Zweilous
pokemon.description: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.

pokemon.name: Hydreigon
pokemon.description: The heads on their arms do not have brains. They use all three heads to consume and destroy everything.

pokemon.name: Larvesta
pokemon.description: It is born in an active volcano. Its body is always cloaked in flames, so it looks like a big ball of fire.

pokemon.name: Volcarona
pokemon.description: A sea of fire engulfs the surroundings of their battles, since they use their six wings to scatter their ember scales.

pokemon.name: Cobalion
pokemon.description: It has a body and heart of steel. Its glare is sufficient to make even an unruly Pokémon obey it.

pokemon.name: Terrakion
pokemon.description: Its charge is strong enough to break through a giant castle wall in one blow. This Pokémon is spoken of in legends.

pokemon.name: Virizion
pokemon.description: This Pokémon fought humans in order to protect its friends. Legends about it continue to be passed down.

pokemon.name: Tornadus
pokemon.description: Tornadus expels massive energy from its tail, causing severe storms. Its power is great enough to blow houses away.

pokemon.name: Thundurus
pokemon.description: Countless charred remains mar the landscape of places through which Thundurus has passed.

pokemon.name: Reshiram
pokemon.description: This Legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with fire. It helps those who want to build a world of truth.

pokemon.name: Zekrom
pokemon.description: This Legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with lightning. It assists those who want to build an ideal world.

pokemon.name: Landorus
pokemon.description: The energy that comes pouring from its tail increases the nutrition in the soil, making crops grow to great size.

pokemon.name: Kyurem
pokemon.description: It can produce ultracold air. Its body is frozen.

pokemon.name: Keldeo
pokemon.description: By blasting water from its hooves, it can glide across water. It excels at using leg moves while battling.

pokemon.name: Meloetta
pokemon.description: The melodies sung by Meloetta have the power to make Pokémon that hear them happy or sad.

pokemon.name: Genesect
pokemon.description: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.
